critique: This document is an executive order regarding the transfer of funds between government departments during the Great Depression. It is difficult to assess its ideological tilt as it is primarily an administrative action. There is no mention of immigration. It does not expand executive power in any significant way, as it simply executes an existing appropriation. It could be argued that it centralizes power at the federal level, but this is inherent in the context of a national emergency and federal programs. It does not directly address national security or civil liberties. It involves government intervention in the economy through the allocation of funds. It does not directly address social inclusion.
